issue.title: Introduce mtls (client certificate) support for callbacks
issue.body:
### Proposal

Based on the official documentation:
https://wiremock.org/docs/webhooks-and-callbacks/
it's possible via json definition to define callback.

What I miss is the option to refer to:
* client certificate (in the pfx format) as well as 
* passphrase 

My preference would be to have an option to define it in the json format.

### References

_No response_

Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

issue.title: Feature request: a way to disable admin API endpoint "/__admin"
issue.body:
We use wiremock in standalone mode with JSON files for configuration. Sometimes we need to have wiremock available on a public endpoint so for obvious security reasons we would like to have a way to disable the admin API endpoint completely.

For example, adding a `--disable-admin-api` command line argument.

Or is there another solution already available to achieve this?

comment.body:
Had a similar question. I couldn't find if there was a way to disable it but there appears to be an undocumented command-line option to set Basic Auth on the Admin API.

https://github.com/wiremock/wiremock/blob/3.2.0/src/main/java/com/github/tomakehurst/wiremock/standalone/CommandLineOptions.java#L99

issue.title: Wiremock's default gzip encoder adds ~28 bytes to the "Content-Lenght" header
issue.body:
**Wiremock version**: 2.32.0
 **Wiremock config**: 
```
WireMockServer wireMockServer = startWireMockServer(mockName,
            options().port(mockHttpPort)
                .httpsPort(Options.DYNAMIC_PORT)
                .keystorePath(keyStorePath)
                .bindAddress(bindAddress)
                .withRootDirectory(Paths.get("build/mock-servers/" + mockName).toAbsolutePath().toString()));
```
 **Request headers**
```
  "content-type" : "application/json",
      "app_brand" : "***",
      "x-api-lang" : "en",
      "hardware_id" : "***",
      "accept-encoding" : "gzip",
      "accept" : "image/h264, image/jpeg",
      "user-agent" :  "***"
```
 **Case details**:
  When we proxy our requests through the Wiremock proxy with headers ` "accept" : "image/h264, image/jpeg", "accept-encoding" : "gzip"` we receive the wrong "Content-Lenght" header response. It looks like Wiremock adds ~ 28 bytes to the header on decoding/encoding image/h264 while proxying. No transformations are done during this request.
 
 **Steps to reproduce:**
- Send any request with `"accept-encoding" : "gzip"` and  default `gzipDisabled` option (which is set to `false` i.e gzip encoding/decoding is enabled by default) to the server which should return any media file encoded in h/264 ByteStream through the Wiremock proxy requests option;
- Verify ByteStream length and "Content-Lenght" header values. They should be the same.
In our case app receives 
`Failure OtherException(throwable=java.io.IOException: Content-Length (23612) and stream length (23584) disagree)`
_Note:_ Our case passes when we set `gzipDisabled` to true. This is not the issue solver as we do need gzip encoding/decoding on some requests.

comment.body:
Please can you share all the steps necessary to reproduce this?

A working test case would be ideal.

comment.body:
I think we should still throw the exception if it's not `FileNotFoundException`. Only return empty when it's exactly that exception.

We can probably do this with two catch blocks rather than `instanceof`.

The notifier call should be at `error` if it's not a not-found error.

issue.title: Adding retry ability to WireMock Verify
issue.body:
Currently not using configuration settings
to set retry counts or fixed delay.
Add

## References

#2418 

## Submitter checklist

- [x] Recommended: Join [WireMock Slack](https://slack.wiremock.org/) to get any help in `#help-contributing` or a project-specific channel like `#wiremock-java`
- [x] Recommended: If you participate in Hacktoberfest 2023, make sure you're [signed up](https://wiremock.org/events/hacktoberfest/) there and in the WireMock form 
- [ ] The PR request is well described and justified, including the body and the references
- [ ] The PR title represents the desired changelog entry
- [x] The repository's code style is followed (see the contributing guide)
- [x] Test coverage that demonstrates that the change works as expected
- [x] For new features, there's necessary documentation in this pull request or in a subsequent PR to [wiremock.org](https://github.com/wiremock/wiremock.org)

comment.body:
@tomakehurst alright, so I am again looking at this issue and I need to explain why I am a bit confused by what you may think the `verifyThat` function is doing or doing wrong.

`verifyThat` will ask WireMock to return a full list of requests that it has received -> then it applies a search for a specific type and verifies the number that show in the list.
-> In this, there is *no point at which we are waiting* for results, which is where I can see the use of a `CompletableFuture timeout`.
    -> The issue I am trying to solve is WireMock giving us the wrong answer. So, it does return results and quickly. I can't see a way to solve this where we don't add a retry at some level.
    
The way you were describing CompletableFuture, I thought there was a method that you could tell it what result you want from the Task and it would maybe auto retry it for you until it returned what you were looking for or timedout.

review.body: Uhm. It will make the test lesss flaky but I do not think it will fix the issue entirely. I suggest creating a follow-up github issue and adding a `FIXME` comment with a reference
